events.originalText: Spanair Flight 5022 crashed just after take-off from Madrid's Barajas Airport, killing 154 people.
events.subtitle: Spanair Flight 5022
events.headline: Spanair Flight 5022 crashes in Madrid, killing 154

events.originalText: The Al-Shifa pharmaceutical factory (pictured) in Sudan was destroyed by a missile attack launched by the United States in retaliation for the August 7 U.S. embassy bombings.
events.subtitle: Al-Shifa pharmaceutical factory
events.headline: Al-Shifa pharmaceutical factory destroyed by US missile in Sudan

events.originalText: The final stage of the O-Bahn Busway in Adelaide, South Australia, was completed, at the time the world's longest and fastest guided busway with buses travelling a total of 12 km (7.5 mi) at maximum speeds of up to 100 km/h (62 mph).
events.subtitle: O-Bahn Busway
events.headline: O-Bahn Busway completed in Adelaide, South Australia

events.originalText: After colliding with the dredger Bowbelle on the River Thames in London, the pleasure boatMarchioness sank in just thirty seconds, killing 51 people.
events.subtitle: Dredging
events.headline: Marchioness pleasure boat sinks in River Thames, 51 dead

events.originalText: The Troubles: The Provisional Irish Republican Army bombed a bus carrying British Army soldiers in Northern Ireland, killing eight of them and wounding another twenty-eight.
events.subtitle: The Troubles
events.headline: IRA bombs bus in Northern Ireland, killing 8 British soldiers

events.originalText: Fires in the United States' Yellowstone National Park ravaged more than 150,000 acres (610 km2), the single-worst day of the conflagration.
events.subtitle: Yellowstone National Park
events.headline: Yellowstone National Park fires ravage over 150,000 acres

events.originalText: Korean War: United Nations forces repelled an attempt by North Korea to capture the city of Taegu.
events.subtitle: Korean War
events.headline: UN forces repel North Korea's attempt to capture Taegu

events.originalText: The American Professional Football Association, a predecessor of the National Football League, was founded.
events.subtitle: National Football League
events.headline: American Professional Football Association founded

events.originalText: Hurricane-force winds combined hundreds of small fires in the U.S. states of Washington and Idaho into the Devil's Broom fire, which burned about 4,700 square miles (12,100 km²), the largest fire in recorded U.S. history.
events.subtitle: Washington (state)
events.headline: Devil's Broom fire burns 4,700 square miles in Washington and Idaho

events.originalText: Pluto was photographed for the first time at the Yerkes Observatory in Williams Bay, Wisconsin, U.S., 21 years before it was officially discovered by Clyde Tombaugh.
events.subtitle: Pluto
events.headline: Pluto photographed for the first time at Yerkes Observatory

events.originalText: American troops defeated the Northwestern Confederacy, a Native American alliance, at the Battle of Fallen Timbers, the decisive battle of the Northwest Indian War.
events.subtitle: Northwestern Confederacy
events.headline: American troops defeat Northwestern Confederacy at Battle of Fallen Timbers

events.originalText: War of the Spanish Succession: A Spanish Bourbon army commanded by the Marquis de Bay was soundly defeated by a multinational army led by the Austrian commander Guido Starhemberg.
events.subtitle: War of the Spanish Succession
events.headline: Spanish Bourbon army defeated in War of the Spanish Succession

events.originalText: The first Siege of Pensacola came to an end with the British and Creek abandoning their attempt to capture Pensacola in Spanish Florida.
events.subtitle: Siege of Pensacola (1707)
events.headline: First Siege of Pensacola ends with British and Creek retreat

events.originalText: Byzantine–Bulgarian wars: Bulgarian forces led by Tsar Simeon I drove the Byzantines out of Thrace with a decisive victory at the Battle of Achelous.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Bulgarian wars
events.headline: Bulgarian forces drive Byzantines out of Thrace in Battle of Achelous

events.originalText: Rashidun forces led by Khalid ibn al-Walid took control of Syria and Palestine in the Battle of the Yarmuk, marking the first great wave of Muslim conquests.
events.subtitle: Rashidun Caliphate
events.headline: Rashidun forces conquer Syria and Palestine in Battle of the Yarmuk
